FuncDef:
The alarm-threshold route command sets a threshold and log recovery percentage for the number of EVPN routes.
The undo alarm-threshold route command cancels the settings. The alarm-threshold route command sets a threshold and log recovery percentage for the number of EVPN routes. The undo alarm-threshold route command cancels the settings. By default, the threshold and log recovery percentage for the number of EVPN routes are not configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the threshold for the number of EVPN routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the log recovery percentage.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 95. After the threshold for the number of EVPN routes is set, the log recovery percentage is 80 by default.
